cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 205 miles ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest, then slowing and bending W-NW/W toward the North and South Carolina coasts before drifting inland across the Carolinas and toward the Ohio Valley early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southern North Carolina coast (Wilmington area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC; Storm Surge Watch north of Duck NC to NC/VA border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds; Tropical Storm Warning north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA and Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire North and South Carolina coastline, with surge impacts extending into southeastern Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Remnant circulation could bring occasional gusts below tropical-storm force (generally <39 mph) when it approaches the Great Lakes early next week
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – Detroit is far inland on the Detroit River/Great Lakes system
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of remnant tropical rainfall possible Monday–Tuesday, which could cause ponding and minor river rises
weather_observation.other_hazards: Periods of reduced visibility, possible debris on connecting highways/rail lines, and high water on inland rivers that could temporarily slow barge traffic
